lines.text: The lights have gone out, madam.

[Pfister gets a mocking aplause from everyone]
Good old Pfister, soon figured that one out.
That vase cost me five thousand dollars. There are only three like it in the world.
Two.
Yes... two.
Thank you for a lovely evening, Kate, shall we see you in the morning?
Oh, who knows if any of us will ever see the morning?
Is he still married?
Widower.
Widower than what?
What do you mean "Widower than what"?
You said he was widower.
He is.
Widower than what?
I don't know what you're talking about. He isn't widower than anything.
You mean he's just a "wittle" man.
That's right.
That's all I was asking.
[repeated line]
Do I have to do everything? Drunken sot!
[first lines]
It's not what you think.
[collapses and camera pans right then stops]
Well, it's partly what you think but, uh, oh it's so complicated.
[dies]
Where's Francis Jr.?
I don't know, Kate. He told me he was coming up this afternoon. I thought sure he'd be here in time for dinner.
One of my dresses is missing. Has he been at it again?
No!
[stammering]
Uh, n-n-no no I.

[explaining to Vickie]
My son does this wonderful impression of Aunt Kate. He's got her voice down to a tee. And well, sometimes he likes to, uh, put on one of Aunt Kate's dresses to entertain at family gatherings.
I see.

[upbeat]
Oh, you should have seen him last Christmas. Such fun.

[sarcastic]
Yes. And when the police dragged him out of the ladies room at Sach's Fifth Avenue, *that* was fun.
I know that one of you is a werewolf. I saw you in the garden this afternoon.
Now if anything frightens you. Anything at all. You just holler.

[screams]
Just practising.
Something terrible has happened! I just found cousin Francis in my bed!
Was he wearing a dress?
Yes, he was.
Just ask him to leave, Sir. Tell him you have a headache.
Beat it! While you're still healthy.
Now you think this would frighten me. Well it doesn't. Because I know this is just a filthy figment of my diseased imagination. All I have to do is simply reach out my hand and touch it!
Yes Sir. It's the biggest thrill of my life. I can tell you that!
Larry... Aaow! This thing's pinching my butt!
I gotta go to The Can! What do you want me to do?
Holy baloney, here we go again.
This is gonna be some wedding. A loony for a husband, and Peter Pan for his wife.
Everything is going to change, I promise, so long as you have faith in me.
You're a very pursuasive man.
It's all done with mirrors.
I love your lipstick, what's it called?
Pink Passion!
[they laugh awkwardly]
Well quit passion it around!
[last lines]
are you so sure that our story has ended? Hmmm? Until next time, this is your host wishing you... pleasant dreams...
[chuckles wickedly]
Say, did'ja hear what the bug said to the windshield?
What?
That's me all over.
I am Pfister, the family butler.
Yes! And I am that little boy you used to bathe and tuck into bed and bring warm milk and cookies to, just before you kissed me goodnight.
May I have your name please?
My name?
Is he kidding?
Come in, Mr. Kidding. *I'll* take the bags.

[surprised]
Master Larry!
Pfister, you *do* remember me.
Of *course*. When did you get here?
About fifteen minutes ago.
I wish I'd known. I would have greeted you myself.
Oh yes, that would have been nice. Well, huh, we can't have everything.
Come along, you're in your old room.
Oh, good.
My brother John, from whom you are all descended, was bitten on the back of his neck by something that was half animal, half human. From that moment on, he was hairy, all over.
I'm telling you, I felt a cold, dead body lying beside me in bed. Do you understand?
I feel that every night. Warm brandy helps.
Come on, Mickey. Weren't they nice? I love show folks, they're so full of life.
Wait! Oh, wait. Before this moment is over, I want to say that this house has been under a cloud of darkness for so many years. And now, at last, the cloud has pissed.
You're the only living soul who knows I've changed my Will. If you ever tell anyone then may your soul rot in Hell!
[last lines]
I'm the golden boy in this family... NOT Cousin Larry
[hitting Larry]
I'm Smarter than Cousin Larry... I'm better looking than Cousin Larry... and I'm gonna be a hellava lot richer than...

[Larry's dancing with a dead Francis Jr]
these showman types and their relationships are so life like

[noticing that Vickie has seen the phone line is dead]
Larry's not the only actor in the family
You murdering skunk

[shrugs as he dons black gloves]
I'm just trying to earn a buck
